thread.title: Mets put Lagares in center, move Cespedes to left for Game 4
thread.title_full: Mets put Lagares in center, move Cespedes to left for Game 4 - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Mets put Lagares in center, move Cespedes to left for Game 4
text:
Corey Sipkin/New York Daily News In Game 3, Mets' Juan Lagares cannot get to Adrian Gonzalez’s seventh-inning home run. With the rookie lefty on the mound to try to clinch the NLDS, Terry Collins went with his best defensive lineup Tuesday night. Gold Glover Juan Lagares was back in center field, and Yoenis Cespedes moved to left against the Dodgers lefty ace Clayton Kershaw.
Collins basically went with the same lineup that erupted for 13 runs off lefthander Brett Anderson Monday night, only flipping catcher Travis d’Arnaud, who has suddenly caught the hot hand, and struggling Lucas Duda.
LIVE BLOG: FOLLOW THE METS-DODGERS SERIES
Lagares made good contact off Anderson with a hard-hit double. He had more success this season against lefties than right-handed pitchers, hitting .273 against southpaws and .253 against righties.
